clusters.title: One of the oddest UN resolutions in history seeks to solidify shaky Gaza ceasefire into an enduring peace
clusters.neutral_headline: UN Security Council Endorses Trump's Gaza Plan

items.title: One of the oddest UN resolutions in history seeks to solidify shaky Gaza ceasefire into an enduring peace
items.standfirst: The hazy UN resolution dictates that Trump’s ‘board of peace’ will supervise an International Stabilisation Force, whose membership is as yet undeterminedThe resolution passed by the UN security council on Tuesday evening, aimed at turning the precarious Gaza ceasefire into a real peace plan, is one of the oddest in United Nations history.It puts Donald Trump in supreme control of Gaza, perhaps with Tony Blair as his immediate subordinate in a “board of peace”, which will oversee multinational peacekeeping troops, a committee of Palestinian technocrats and a local police force, for a period of two years. Continue reading...
items.content: The hazy UN resolution dictates that Trump’s ‘board of peace’ will supervise an International Stabilisation Force, whose membership is as yet undeterminedThe resolution passed by the UN security council on Tuesday evening, aimed at turning the precarious Gaza ceasefire into a real peace plan, is one of the oddest in United Nations history.It puts Donald Trump in supreme control of Gaza, perhaps with Tony Blair as his immediate subordinate in a “board of peace”, which will oversee multinational peacekeeping troops, a committee of Palestinian technocrats and a local police force, for a period of two years. Continue reading...

items.title: UN Security Council votes for international force for Gaza
items.standfirst: There were 13 votes in favor of the text, which Trump claimed would lead to "further Peace all over the World," with only Russia and China abstaining – but no vetoes
items.content: There were 13 votes in favor of the text, which Trump claimed would lead to "further Peace all over the World," with only Russia and China abstaining – but no vetoes

items.title: Trump's plan for Gaza backed by UN Security Council
items.standfirst: Included in the 20-point peace plan is the establishment of an International Stabilisation Force (ISF), which would work to demilitarise the territory.
items.content: Included in the 20-point peace plan is the establishment of an International Stabilisation Force (ISF), which would work to demilitarise the territory.

items.title: U.N. Security Council approves U.S.-brokered Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: The U.N. Security Council has approved a U.S. plan for Gaza that authorizes an international stabilization force to provide security in the Palestinian territory.
items.content: The U.N. Security Council has approved a U.S. plan for Gaza that authorizes an international stabilization force to provide security in the Palestinian territory.

items.title: U.N. Security Council adopts U.S. resolution on Gaza plan
items.standfirst: The United Nations Security Council has voted to adopt a U.S. resolution outlining President Trump's peace plan for post-war Gaza. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has the details.
items.content: The United Nations Security Council has voted to adopt a U.S. resolution outlining President Trump's peace plan for post-war Gaza. CBS News senior foreign correspondent Holly Williams has the details.

items.title: UN security council votes to endorse Donald Trump’s Gaza plan
items.standfirst: The resolution, which includes references to an independent Palestine, was passed by a vote of 13-0 with China and Russia abstaining The UN security council has endorsed proposals put forward by Donald Trump for a lasting peace in Gaza, including the deployment of an international stabilisation force and a possible path to a sovereign Palestinian state.The resolution, passed by a vote of 13-0 with abstentions by China and Russia, charted “a new course in the Middle East for Israelis and Palestinians and all the people of the region alike”, the US envoy to the UN, Mike Waltz, told the council chamber. Continue reading...
items.content: The resolution, which includes references to an independent Palestine, was passed by a vote of 13-0 with China and Russia abstaining The UN security council has endorsed proposals put forward by Donald Trump for a lasting peace in Gaza, including the deployment of an international stabilisation force and a possible path to a sovereign Palestinian state.The resolution, passed by a vote of 13-0 with abstentions by China and Russia, charted “a new course in the Middle East for Israelis and Palestinians and all the people of the region alike”, the US envoy to the UN, Mike Waltz, told the council chamber. Continue reading...

items.title: The U.N. Security Council approves a U.S. plan for a Gaza stabilization force
items.standfirst: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.
items.content: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)

items.title: UN Security Council passes US resolution backing international Gaza force
items.standfirst: Measure mandates transitional administration for Gaza and floats 'credible pathway' for Palestinian statehood.
items.content: Measure mandates transitional administration for Gaza and floats 'credible pathway' for Palestinian statehood.

items.title: 'A moment of true historic proportion': Trump welcomes UN vote on Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: The UN Security Council has passed a US-drafted resolution which supports Donald Trump's peace plan for Gaza.
items.content: The UN Security Council has passed a US-drafted resolution which supports Donald Trump's peace plan for Gaza.

items.title: UN approves US plan authorising international stabilisation force in Gaza
items.standfirst: The United Nations Security Council on Monday approved a United States plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force and outlines a potential route towards an independent Palestinian state, marking a significant step for the fragile ceasefire after more than two years of war.
items.content: The United Nations Security Council on Monday approved a United States plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force and outlines a potential route towards an independent Palestinian state, marking a significant step for the fragile ceasefire after more than two years of war.

items.title: UN to vote on Gaza stabilisation force plan that references Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Netanyahu faces pressure from far-right ministers after Saudi insistence on ‘credible pathway’ to statehoodThe UN security council is to vote on Monday on a US-drafted resolution to set up an international stabilisation force (ISF) in Gaza that includes a late and highly tentative addition on a future Palestinian state, added under pressure from Arab states.A rival motion has meanwhile been tabled by Russia and China, setting up the possibility that both motions could be vetoed by one or more of the five permanent members of the security council. Continue reading...
items.content: Netanyahu faces pressure from far-right ministers after Saudi insistence on ‘credible pathway’ to statehoodThe UN security council is to vote on Monday on a US-drafted resolution to set up an international stabilisation force (ISF) in Gaza that includes a late and highly tentative addition on a future Palestinian state, added under pressure from Arab states.A rival motion has meanwhile been tabled by Russia and China, setting up the possibility that both motions could be vetoed by one or more of the five permanent members of the security council. Continue reading...

items.title: U.N. Security Council approves Trump's Gaza peace plan
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan was passed by a majority vote at the United Nations on Monday, though world powers were still divided over whether it can convert a fragile ceasefire into the long-term solution that has eluded the Middle East
items.content: President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan was passed by a majority vote at the United Nations on Monday, though world powers were still divided over whether it can convert a fragile ceasefire into the long-term solution that has eluded the Middle East

ai_summary: The UN Security Council voted to approve a U.S. plan for Gaza.
The plan authorizes an international stabilization force for security.
The resolution passed with 13 votes in favor, Russia and China abstaining.
The plan includes references to an independent Palestine.
Donald Trump will have supreme control of Gaza for two years.

items.title: Former US treasury chief steps back from public roles after Epstein revelations
items.standfirst: Former US treasury secretary Larry Summers said Monday he will withdraw from all public commitments, days after President Donald Trump ordered a Justice Department investigation into his and other Democrats’ ties to Jeffrey Epstein. Released documents revealed personal correspondence between Summers and the convicted sex offender.

items.title: ‘Deeply ashamed’ Larry Summers steps back from public life over Epstein links
items.standfirst: Former treasury secretary steps away to ‘rebuild trust’ after severe backlash but will continue teaching Harvard classes The Harvard professor and economist Larry Summers said he would be stepping back from public life after documents released by the House oversight committee revealed email exchanges between Summers and the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, who called himself Summers’ “wing man”.Politico reported on Monday that Summers, a former treasury secretary, expressed deep regret for past messages with Epstein. Continue reading...
items.content: Former treasury secretary steps away to ‘rebuild trust’ after severe backlash but will continue teaching Harvard classes The Harvard professor and economist Larry Summers said he would be stepping back from public life after documents released by the House oversight committee revealed email exchanges between Summers and the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, who called himself Summers’ “wing man”.Politico reported on Monday that Summers, a former treasury secretary, expressed deep regret for past messages with Epstein. Continue reading...

Emails revealed deeper ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
Summers sought Epstein's advice and made sexist remarks.
Correspondence showed personal communication between the two.
Summers says he is deeply ashamed of the released messages.

items.title: Trump says he won't rule out sending troops to Venezuela amid military buildup in region
items.standfirst: The aircraft carrier USS Gerald Ford has arrived in the Caribbean, giving the United States the ability to strike inside Venezuela if President Trump gives the order. The U.S. has also sent thousands of troops to the region. Charlie D'Agata reports from Puerto Rico.
items.content: The aircraft carrier USS Gerald Ford has arrived in the Caribbean, giving the United States the ability to strike inside Venezuela if President Trump gives the order. The U.S. has also sent thousands of troops to the region. Charlie D'Agata reports from Puerto Rico.

items.title: Trump says he would be 'OK' launching strikes in Mexico to fight drug smuggling

items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum has repeatedly said that U.S. military action in the country without her permission will not happen.

items.title: Trump open to talks with Venezuela's Maduro, says US strikes in Mexico 'ok'
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said Monday he is open to speaking with Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and would not rule out deploying US troops, while also saying he'd be "OK" with launching anti-drug strikes inside Mexico – remarks that heighten tensions amid a major US military buildup in the region.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said Monday he is open to speaking with Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro and would not rule out deploying US troops, while also saying he'd be "OK" with launching anti-drug strikes inside Mexico – remarks that heighten tensions amid a major US military buildup in the region.

items.standfirst: The most advanced US aircraft carrier has travelled to the Caribbean Sea in what has been interpreted as a show of military power and a possible threat to Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro regime.
items.content: The most advanced US aircraft carrier has travelled to the Caribbean Sea in what has been interpreted as a show of military power and a possible threat to Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro regime.

items.title: U.S. intensifies military pressure on Venezuela as Trump considers talks with Maduro
items.standfirst: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump said Sunday he may hold talks with Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro, even as the United States intensified its military pressure with the latest strike on an alleged drug boat and the arrival of its most advanced aircraft carrier
items.content: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump said Sunday he may hold talks with Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro, even as the United States intensified its military pressure with the latest strike on an alleged drug boat and the arrival of its most advanced aircraft carrier

items.title: Trump says House Republicans should vote to release Epstein files

items.content: In a reversal, President Trump says House Republicans should vote to release the Jeffrey Epstein files. House GOP leaders intend to hold a vote Tuesday, sources say.

items.title: Judge accuses DOJ of "disturbing pattern" of missteps in Comey case

items.content: In a blistering opinion, a federal judge in Virginia accused Justice Department prosecutor Lindsay Halligan of misconduct, saying there was a "disturbing pattern of profound investigative missteps." Scott MacFarlane has more.

items.content: President Trump has changed his mind and is now calling on the House to vote to force the Justice Department to release all of its files on Jeffrey Epstein. Nancy Cordes has details.

items.title: Trump urges House Republicans to vote for release of Epstein files
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Sunday backed Republican lawmakers’ efforts to release more files on sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, despite previously opposing the move. But this change of heart does not mean the documents will be public soon, or even ever. France24 Charli James walks us through the different political paths for Congress and Trump.

clusters.title: Demonstrators cheer guilty verdict for former Bangladeshi PM Hasina
clusters.neutral_headline: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sentenced to Death

items.title: Demonstrators cheer guilty verdict for former Bangladeshi PM Hasina
items.standfirst: Some of the protesters who helped to oust Sheikh Hasina from power say her death sentence is a first step to justice.
items.content: Some of the protesters who helped to oust Sheikh Hasina from power say her death sentence is a first step to justice.

items.title: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death for crimes against humanity
items.standfirst: Hasina sentenced in absentia by court in Dhaka over deadly crackdown on student-led uprising last yearBangladesh’s deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a court in Dhaka for crimes against humanity over a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising last year.A three-judge bench of the country’s international crimes tribunal convicted Hasina of crimes including incitement, orders to kill and inaction to prevent atrocities as she oversaw a crackdown on anti-government protesters last year. Continue reading...
items.content: Hasina sentenced in absentia by court in Dhaka over deadly crackdown on student-led uprising last yearBangladesh’s deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a court in Dhaka for crimes against humanity over a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising last year.A three-judge bench of the country’s international crimes tribunal convicted Hasina of crimes including incitement, orders to kill and inaction to prevent atrocities as she oversaw a crackdown on anti-government protesters last year. Continue reading...

items.title: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister sentenced to death for role in protest crackdown
items.standfirst: A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India and was sentenced in absentia.
items.content: A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India and was sentenced in absentia.(Image credit: Rajesh Kumar Singh)

items.title: Moment Ex-Bangladesh leader Sheikh Hasina's sentence is announced
items.standfirst: Hasina has called the court's decision "biased and politically motivated" in a statement released after the verdict.
items.content: Hasina has called the court's decision "biased and politically motivated" in a statement released after the verdict.

items.title: Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death after lethal crackdown on uprising
items.standfirst: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death.
items.content: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death.

ai_summary: Sheikh Hasina was sentenced to death in absentia.

The charges stem from a crackdown on protesters.
Hasina fled to India before the sentencing.
The court's decision was called "biased" by Hasina.

items.title: Macron and Zelensky sign a letter of intent for Ukraine to purchase up to 100 Rafale fighter jets

clusters.title: New blow for Louvre as structural problem forces gallery closure
clusters.neutral_headline: Louvre Museum Closes Gallery Due to Structural Issues

items.title: New blow for Louvre as structural problem forces gallery closure
items.standfirst: Campana Gallery is temporarily shut due to weaknesses in beams supporting floor above The Louvre has temporarily closed one of its galleries as a precaution after an audit revealed structural weaknesses in some of the beams in the building.The Campana Gallery, which houses nine rooms dedicated to ancient Greek ceramics, will be shut while investigations are conducted into “certain beams supporting the floors of the second floor” above it, a statement issued on Monday said. Continue reading...
items.content: Campana Gallery is temporarily shut due to weaknesses in beams supporting floor above The Louvre has temporarily closed one of its galleries as a precaution after an audit revealed structural weaknesses in some of the beams in the building.The Campana Gallery, which houses nine rooms dedicated to ancient Greek ceramics, will be shut while investigations are conducted into “certain beams supporting the floors of the second floor” above it, a statement issued on Monday said. Continue reading...

items.title: Louvre closes gallery due to structural issue
items.standfirst: The Campana Gallery, which host Greek ceramics, will remain closed as beams supporting the floor above are checked.
items.content: The Campana Gallery, which host Greek ceramics, will remain closed as beams supporting the floor above are checked.

items.title: Louvre closes Greek ceramics gallery over structural safety concerns
items.standfirst: France’s most famous museum, The Louvre, has temporarily closed its Campana Gallery on Monday, after an audit uncovered structural weaknesses in beams supporting the floor above, prompting safety concerns. This comes as the embattled museum is already under scrutiny following last month’s $102 million jewellery heist.
items.content: France’s most famous museum, The Louvre, has temporarily closed its Campana Gallery on Monday, after an audit uncovered structural weaknesses in beams supporting the floor above, prompting safety concerns. This comes as the embattled museum is already under scrutiny following last month’s $102 million jewellery heist.

ai_summary: The Louvre closed the Campana Gallery.
The closure is due to structural weaknesses.
Weaknesses were found in supporting beams.
The gallery houses ancient Greek ceramics.
Investigations are underway into the beams.

items.title: Jeff Bezos reportedly launches new AI startup with himself as CEO
items.standfirst: Former Amazon CEO to co-head Project Prometheus with tech executive Vik Bajaj, according to the New York TimesAfter stepping down as Amazon’s CEO four years ago, Jeff Bezos, the billionaire founder and former chief executive of the online shopping company, is going to be a CEO again. This time, Bezos has appointed himself co-CEO of an AI startup called Project Prometheus, the New York Times reported, citing anonymous sources.The startup, which will focus on developing AI for engineering and manufacturing in various fields, has already received $6.2bn in funding – more than many companies are able to raise in their lifetimes. Leading the company alongside Bezos is his co-founder and co-CEO Vik Bajaj, a celebrity tech executive in his own right. Bajaj is a physicist and chemist best known for his work at Google’s moonshot factory, X, where he founded the health startup Verily. Continue reading...
items.content: Former Amazon CEO to co-head Project Prometheus with tech executive Vik Bajaj, according to the New York TimesAfter stepping down as Amazon’s CEO four years ago, Jeff Bezos, the billionaire founder and former chief executive of the online shopping company, is going to be a CEO again. This time, Bezos has appointed himself co-CEO of an AI startup called Project Prometheus, the New York Times reported, citing anonymous sources.The startup, which will focus on developing AI for engineering and manufacturing in various fields, has already received $6.2bn in funding – more than many companies are able to raise in their lifetimes. Leading the company alongside Bezos is his co-founder and co-CEO Vik Bajaj, a celebrity tech executive in his own right. Bajaj is a physicist and chemist best known for his work at Google’s moonshot factory, X, where he founded the health startup Verily. Continue reading...

clusters.title: The Heritage Foundation Scandal and the Growth of Anti-Semitism on the Right
clusters.neutral_headline: Heritage board member resigns over organization's defense of Tucker Carlson

items.title: The Heritage Foundation Scandal and the Growth of Anti-Semitism on the Right
items.standfirst: Today, Princeton professor and prominent conservative political theorist Robert George resigned from the Heritage Foundation board in protest of Heritage President Kevin Robert's defense of anti-Semitic "influencer" Tucker Carlson and his support of Nick Fuentes, an even more virulent right-wing…
items.content: Today, Princeton professor and prominent conservative political theorist Robert George resigned from the Heritage Foundation board in protest of Heritage President Kevin Robert's defense of anti-Semitic "influencer" Tucker Carlson and his support of Nick Fuentes, an even more virulent right-wing…

items.title: Heritage board member resigns over organization's defense of Tucker Carlson
items.standfirst: Robert P. George said he and the foundation’s president were at an “impasse.”
items.content: Another member of the conservative Heritage Foundation has resigned following a video posted by the organization’s president defending Tucker Carlson’s interview with Holocaust denier Nick Fuentes. In a post to Facebook, board member Robert P. George said he can no longer remain part of the foundation without a “full retraction” of the video released last month by the organization’s president, Kevin Roberts. “Although Kevin publicly apologized for some of what he said in the video, he could not offer a full retraction of its content. So, we reached an impasse,” George said. Carlson’s interview with Fuentes — who has previously expressed admiration for Adolf Hitler — received widespread condemnation for antisemitism, and the aftermath has exposed fault lines among conservatives. In his Oct. 30 video, Roberts denounced the "venomous coalition” criticizing both Fuentes and Carlson, adding that Carlson is a “close friend.” He said that though he disagrees with and even “abhors” things Fuentes said, he did not believe in “canceling” him or Carlson. On Sunday, President Donald Trump also defended Carlson, telling reporters “you can’t tell him who to interview.” Fuentes, a well-known provocateur on the right, has previously said that “organized Jewry” is leading to the disappearance of white culture. Roberts later said he “didn’t know much about this Fuentes guy,” and that his video script was written by an aide who has since resigned. George on Monday said that Roberts is a “good man” who acknowledged a “serious mistake.” “What divided us was a difference of opinion about what was required to rectify the mistake,” George added. A spokesman for the Heritage Foundation confirmed George's resignation in a statement to POLITICO, thanking him for his service and calling him a "good man" before defending Roberts. "Under the leadership of Dr. Roberts, Heritage remains resolute in building an America where freedom, opportunity, prosperity, and civil society flourish. We are strong, growing, and more determined than ever to fight for our Republic," the spokesman said. George, the McCormick professor of jurisprudence and director of the James Madison Program in American Ideals and Institutions at Princeton University, had been a Heritage trustee since 2019, according to the foundation’s website. His resignation is one of several in light of Roberts' video, including at least five members of the foundation’s antisemitism task force, according to CBS News. “I pray that Heritage’s research and advocacy will be guided by the conviction that each and every member of the human family, irrespective of race, ethnicity, religion, or anything else, as a creature fashioned in the very image of God, is “created equal” and “endowed by our Creator with certain unalienable rights,” George said.

ai_summary: Robert George resigned from the Heritage Foundation board.
George protested Heritage President Kevin Roberts' actions.
Roberts defended Tucker Carlson and Nick Fuentes.
George and Roberts reached an impasse.
The issue involves anti-Semitic views.
